channel.title: [PI]Closing Teleport interface after teleporting
channel.description:
Whatsup guys,
I'm not sure if this whas already released but i just created it for my own project today.
[B]What does this do?[/B] It closes your Teleport Interface after teleporting. I thought about this because its verry annoying when u are using a Pking teleport and you are bridding you need to close the tab first before u can attack someone.
Ok so here we go:
Find your button ID For Example ID: 176146
Go to your Clickingbuttons and find that Button and it will look like this:
[code] case 176146: c.getPA().spellTeleport(3366, 3266, 0); break;[/code]
So you can see it doesnt do anything, it only teleports you to that location but it doesnt close the Interface.
Under the coords add this: [code] c.setSidebarInterface(6, c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? 1151 : c.playerMagicBook == 1 ? 12855 : c.playerMagicBook == 2 ? 16640 : 12855);[/code]
What this do: It checks what spellbook the player is using> 0,1 or 2. So when you clicked on the teleport it gets you back to your spellbook.
So your button will not look like this: [code] case 177215: c.getPA().spellTeleport(3303, 9375, 0); c.setSidebarInterface(6, c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? 1151 : c.playerMagicBook == 1 ? 12855 : c.playerMagicBook == 2 ? 16640 : 12855); break; [/code]
Thanks for using my snippet.
Remco

item.title: [PI]Closing Teleport interface after teleporting
item.dc:creator: @Raexon Raexon
item.description:
@Raexon wrote:

So your button will not look like this:

		case 177215:
		c.getPA().spellTeleport(3303, 9375, 0);
		c.setSidebarInterface(6, c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? 1151 : c.playerMagicBook == 1 ? 12855 : c.playerMagicBook == 2 ? 16640 : 12855);
		break;

Thanks for using my snippet.

Remco
[/quote]
It that what it should look like or what it shouldn’t and yes I do see the “So your button will not look like this:”

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Closing Teleport interface after teleporting
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“remcowp, post:7, topic:519712”]Im posting it here because the closeAllWindows does not work, i dont think the interface is seen as a “Window”, well try it yourself.[/quote]every interface is a window because that’s what it does is it closes interfaces… closes bank interfaces, skilling interfaces, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Closing Teleport interface after teleporting
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“remcowp, post:5, topic:519712”]Doesnt work for me? Thanks for being negative anyways

@Vain_ Yeah, any idea how i do this?[/quote]We wasn’t being negative I’m pretty sure even the default PI bases had closeAllWindows or something similar…

[hr]

I assume vain meant wherever it talks about players teleporting to add a c.closeAllWindows at the end of all the brackets so it knows okay, after you teleport no matter what to close the interface/window.

would be a lot better to set this in the teleporting methods, and not per teleport call.

item.title: [PI]Closing Teleport interface after teleporting
item.dc:creator: @remcowp remcowp
item.description:
@remcowp wrote:

Whatsup guys,

I’m not sure if this whas already released but i just created it for my own project today.

What does this do? It closes your Teleport Interface after teleporting.
I thought about this because its verry annoying when u are using a Pking teleport and you are bridding you need to close the tab first before u can attack someone.

Ok so here we go:

case 176146: c.getPA().spellTeleport(3366, 3266, 0); break;

So you can see it doesnt do anything, it only teleports you to that location but it doesnt close the Interface.

Under the coords add this:

What this do: It checks what spellbook the player is using> 0,1 or 2. So when you clicked on the teleport it gets you back to your spellbook.

So your button will not look like this:

		case 177215:
